JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Mykhaylo Buromenskiy;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in the village of ORG , ORG region , GPE . She was represented before the ORG by Ms N. PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , from ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
At TIME on DATE the applicant ’s husband was found dead in his home .
DATE the Novotroitskiy District Prosecutor ’s Office ( “ the DPO ” ) instituted proceedings into the murder and ordered a forensic medical examination .
On DATE thirteen neighbours , relatives and friends of the deceased were questioned .
On DATE the forensic examination concluded that the applicant ’s husband had received multiple bodily injuries and had been strangled . His death had occurred during TIME to DATE .
On DATE the ORG questioned a further witness and issued a search warrant in respect of PERSON and Mr D.
On DATE Mr NORP was interrogated .
On DATE CARDINAL more witnesses were questioned .

On DATE the ORG ordered the forensic examination of footprints and fingerprints that had been found at the scene of the crime . The examination reports were completed on DATE ( for the footprints ) and DATE ( for the fingerprints ) .
On DATE CARDINAL more witnesses were questioned .
On DATE Mr NORP was interrogated and a reconstruction was held .
On DATE the investigator granted the applicant aggrieved party status . The applicant was questioned as the aggrieved party .
On DATE Mr D was identified by CARDINAL witnesses as a person who had asked about the deceased ’s place of residence on DATE of the crime – DATE .

On DATE the investigator decided not to prosecute Mr NORP for murder and robbery as he had an alibi for the time of murder . However , the investigator nevertheless considered that Mr NORP , who had arrived at the village with a certain PERSON and PERSON on DATE and had enquired about the deceased ’s place of residence , had to have been aware that this information was wanted by PERSON and PERSON for an illegal purpose , such as burglary . Mr NORP was therefore charged with complicity in burglary .
On DATE Mr NORP was questioned as an accused .
On DATE the investigator arranged for the formal identification of a pair of running shoes by CARDINAL witnesses , who testified that they belonged to PERSON

On DATE another footprint examination was ordered . It was completed on DATE and established that CARDINAL of the footprints at the scene of the crime had been left by a sports shoe belonging to Mr K.

On DATE the investigator issued resolutions to bring charges against PERSON and PERSON of murder for financial gain . The prosecutor issued an arrest warrant with respect to PERSON and PERSON and placed them on a wanted list .
On DATE the investigation was suspended since the whereabouts of the suspects were unknown .
On DATE the investigator ordered a search of PERSON home . The search was carried out DATE .
On DATE the investigator issued a warrant to monitor the telegraphic and postal correspondence of PERSON relatives . On DATE the warrant was sent to the Head of ORG .
On DATE CARDINAL more witnesses were questioned .

On DATE Mr NORP surrendered voluntarily to the prosecutor and was interrogated . At DATE the investigator decided to discontinue the criminal proceedings against Mr R for burglary and murder for lack of evidence . However , on DATE that decision was quashed .
According to the applicant , on the advice of the investigator , she paid MONEY to a lawyer PERSON to represent her in the proceedings but never signed a formal agreement with the lawyer .

On DATE the ORG examined the case against Mr NORP and remitted it for additional investigation ; it instructed the investigator to arrange a confrontation between PERSON and PERSON NORP was released on condition that he did not abscond . The applicant was not present at the hearing but the lawyer PERSON acted on her behalf , allegedly without her authorisation .
On DATE ORG appealed against the decision of DATE . They maintained , in particular , that it was not possible to arrange for a confrontation between Mr NORP and PERSON since PERSON had absconded .
On DATE ORG upheld the decision of ORG .
On DATE an additional medical forensic examination was ordered . The report was completed by DATE .
On DATE Mr NORP was interrogated again . On DATE the investigator decided not to initiate criminal proceedings against Mr NORP for destruction or damage of property with intent .
On DATE Mr NORP was interrogated further and a confrontation was staged between him and PERSON

On DATE the investigator decided not to pursue the prosecution of PERSON on the ground that he had an alibi for the murder that was supported by CARDINAL witnesses . According to PERSON on the eve of the murder Mr D. had asked him to take PERSON and PERSON to the village where the applicant ’s husband lived . He had done so . He had waited for them for TIME and then taken them back to the town of GPE . PERSON denied , and there was no evidence to the contrary , that he had been aware of the true intentions of PERSON and PERSON with respect to the applicant ’s husband .

On DATE , owing to changes in the procedural legislation that required any arrest order to be approved by the court , the investigator submitted a request to ORG for a warrant for Mr K ’s arrest . On DATE the court ordered PERSON to be taken into custody as a preventive measure .
On DATE the proceedings were suspended since the accused ’s whereabouts were unknown . Thereafter the investigation was suspended and resumed several times .
By a letter of DATE the applicant was informed that Mr NORP had absconded and that the criminal proceedings against him were suspended .

Owing to changes in the legislation on criminal procedure , on DATE the investigator requested authorisation from ORG to survey the telegraphic and postal correspondence of PERSON relatives and friends . On DATE the court issued the authorisation .
On DATE the investigator issued a resolution for PERSON property to be seized . The investigator reported , however , that PERSON had no property .

By a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG informed the applicant that they were still looking for PERSON , who had been identified as a suspect . The investigators also checked the possible involvement of PERSON and PERSON in the murder of the applicant ’s husband , but as their was no proof of their guilt , ORG declined to prosecute them and ORG upheld its decisions .

By a letter of DATE ORG informed the applicant that the law - enforcement authorities were still looking for PERSON and that the decisions to close the criminal proceedings against PERSON and PERSON were well - founded
The investigator systematically issued orders to establish PERSON whereabouts on DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE , DATE , and DATE .
